Blog.post: So for the past couple of years I have been using a 15" PowerBook G4 for surfing the web, ripping music for my iPod. The Powerbook was great for some of this, and good for other parts. Being a Windows guy, who appreciates the Mac, and loves the industrial design Apple embraces with their products I have had a hard time finding a replacement for my "tinkering" machine. Surfing the web today I found Acer make a totally sweet machine, the "Acer Ferrari 3200" which not only has a wickedly big screen, built in slot loading DVD burner but is also a AMD64 which will cruise along. Obviously with all these neat features, it has horrible battery life and is a little heavy, the other thing I'm not super excited by is that its Ferrari Red (which isn't bad) with a Ferrari logo as part of the case - sigh. So I guess the future is looking good for finding a replacement, and this is certainly close.

Orbital released their final album in the UK this week, as living proof that the world is getting smaller, I ordered it from UK Amazon site and was listening to it on Wednesday afternoon. Itâ€™s a shame that it will be their last CD as it reminds me considerably of the earlier music that they produced - green album, Orbital 2 etc, Pants, You Lot and One Perfect Sunrise are probably my favorite songs on the album, but as with all CDs I buy my opinions change over time, so (hopefully) I will be able to listen to Bath Time without cringing and skipping forward. :-)

Tonya had the opportunity to show her photos again, this time in Kent at a small restaurant. She had a great display and attracted a reasonable amount of interest for a Friday night, in a quiet little town. The thing that surprised me about Kent, was actually how cool the downtown area seemed to be. I have been to Kent a few times (mostly to drop off Tonya's Grandma), but have never seen this side of it. Wandering around, it reminded me of La Conner which Tonya and I visited spent the day in last summer.

So having put off being a part of the hip blog crowd, I have finally decided to create one. Its more procrastination than anything else that stopped me from having a blog in the past, so lets see how I do at keeping this up to date.

On Thursday night Gomez played a small gig in lower Queen Anne, what a treat it was. They were playing at Easy Street Records on Mercer St. Using much to their disappointment rental instruments vs. Their own. Tonya managed to snap plenty of pictures of them playing and had a great time talking to the band, while I enjoyed hanging out the crowd listening to some great music.
